p.s: The given excerpt is from William Shakespeare's play The Merchant of Venice which was written around 1596.
One of the main characters is the Jewish moneylender Shylock who lends money to his enemy to take revenge on him and whose daughter has ran away.
His situation in the given excerpt will be described in the following text.
Prior to this excerpt, Shylock's daughter Jessica has eloped with a Christian.
Moreover, Shylock has lent money to Antonio, his enemy, under the bond that if he does not repay his debts on time, Shylock will receive one pound of Antonio's flesh.
In the excerpt, Shylock is talking to his friend Tubal who is also Jewish.
He questions Tubal about his missing daughter but Tubal also does not know about Jessica's whereabouts.
Shylock expresses his anger aobut his daughter eloping but his spirits rise when he is told that Antonio has lost one of his ships.

Tubal then tells him that Antonio will go bankrupt due to the loss of the ship which pleases Shylock even more because he realizes that Antonio will break the bond and Shylock will receive what he wanted.
Meanwhile he also expresses his diappointment and anger for his daughter who has taken and spent a lot of his money and his belongings.
Lastly, he orders Tubal to get him an officer to arrest and charge Antonio and hurriedly sends him away.
